definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: When you look at the books, you see he is just one of a hundred students or whatever.
sentences.chinese: 你看看賬本就會明白他只是衆多富家子弟中的一員。

sentences.english: If you’ve never tracked your expenses, try the One Month Challenge.
sentences.chinese: 如果你從不記賬，可以先嚐試“一個月賬本”。

sentences.english: Learn how green data centers can add more to your bottom line.
sentences.chinese: 學習綠色數據中心怎樣促進降低你的賬本底線。

sentences.english: Fixed to the chain were keys, bank-books , money-boxes, and other heavy things.
sentences.chinese: 在鎖鏈上綁着鑰匙，賬本，錢箱，還有其他貴重物品。

sentences.english: A small hotel usually employs an outside accountant to check its books periodically.
sentences.chinese: 小酒店通常聘一位外面的會計師定期覈對賬本。

sentences.english: Cloud hair stolen books to the supervision office.
sentences.chinese: 程雲發將偷來的賬本交給了監督室。

definition: lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
the critical moment/life and death crisis
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
